entityId.localType: Public Record Office of Victoria Series Number

biogHist.abstract: The Institutionalised Children's Register relates to a small number of children in State 'care' in Victoria, over an 8 year period. The entries in this Register are most likely related to payments for child endowment. Further research is required on the provenance as it probably was created by an unidentified institution other than the Children's Welfare Department.
biogHist.p: Conditional Access - Care leavers (and their families) wanting to find information about their time in care, or access personal files can contact Care Leaver Records Service, Freedom of Information Unit, Department of Health and Human Services.

There is one page per child in this volume. The front of each page was set up to record the following detail although these were inconsistently completed - name of child, date and place of birth, date child attains 16 years, parents names, address of parent or guardian, source from which child was received into institution, date of admission and discharge, destination to which child was discharged and details of absences. The reverse of the page recorded the date of claim for child endowment, amounts claimed and amounts received.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Victorian Government Records relating to Wardship and Adoption (1864 - )
